document.discussion_title: Caltex is logical buyer for Woolworths petrol stations: Citi | afr.com
document.topic_text: Citigroup has a "buy" recommendation and $34.94 price target on Caltex. Sasha Woolley by Sarah Thompson Anthony Macdonald Joyce Moullakis Caltex may be the only likely bidder of Woolworths' petrol station business, Citi analyst Dale Koenders wrote in a research note on Friday. As revealed by Street Talk , Morgan Stanley has been mandated to sell the division which is expected to be worth between $1.3 billion and $1.5 billion, Sources said the US investment bank had been working on a potential sale in recent months and had reached out to interested parties. "We think Caltex is one of the few companies that could be interested, if the price is right," Koenders said. "We estimate that a $1.5 billion acquisition could add 5 per cent to 8 per cent earnings per share growth depending on if Caltex can change credit rating metrics, and any resulting need for equity (small)." Related Quote: s 5 years 1 Day Last updated: Updating... Last updated: Updating... View full Quote: Company Profile ASX Announcements Expand ASX Announcements View all announcements Koenders reckons an acquisition is not that straight-forward for most parties given "ACCC risk, wholesale supply from Caltex for circa 10 years, a likely need to provide ongoing discounts, and a risk of dis-synergies for operating convenience stores likely to limit appetite." He has a "buy" recommendation and $34.94 price target on Caltex. AFR Magazine
